result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven William Bruns III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Minot,ADA:   Karl E. Anderson   DF ATTY:  John A Kucinski   DF:  Steven William Bruns appeared from jail. Includes Pleas on 16CM190, PAYH on 15CM432 and 13CF166. Case called at 11:01 am. ADA Anderson recites agreement. Court questions. Court needs address before Def will be released.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. Def pleas Guilty. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Court uses attached report to establish facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Count #1 Sentencing arguments. Crt orders: 1 year probation w/h with conditions: 
- 45 Days Jail STAYED
- $243.00 - Court Costs. To be paid through the Clerk of Courts Office. To be added to payment plan. 
- $200.00 DNA Sample and Surcharge; Apply Bond
- Domestic Violence Assessment
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- No Contact with Mrs. Flink
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
Def to sign a new payment plan. Court quashes warrants.

CO: KK for SRN, RPT: Vicki Kasten, Clerk: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Karl E. Anderson,  DF ATTY: John Kucinski and Intern Alex Dyer, DF:  Steven William Bruns appeared from jail. ADA Anderson states he had been held on cash in Eau Claire County. ADA Anderson is requesting a $1,000.00 CB, Atty Dyer argues. Defendant to meet with the payment clerk on 13CF166 and 15CM432, Defendant to pay $500.00 as well on 13CF166/15CM432. QUASH WARRANT.  Status conference scheduled for March 22, 2018 at 10:45 am.

Apprs: CO: CAR for SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski DF:  Steven William Bruns appeared from jail. Case called at 8:58. Atty. Kucinski updates the court there is an agreement. ADA Hartung agrees. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NC to 15CM432. Court questions DE on his plea. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of 15CM432. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:
- 30 days St. Croix County Jail to be served concurrent to what DE is serving currently.
   with credit for 30 days time served. 
- Costs $243.00
- Domestic Abuse assessment and pay costs of assessment.

DE to meet with the payment clerk. 
Once 20 day appeals has passed the DE will write a letter requesting his phone and glasses to be returned.

Pre-trial conference at 09-15-2015 08:30 am

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Rebecca F. or John O. or the residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.


Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: TCH for SRN, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Matthew L Hartung & Ryan Moertel, DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski,  DF:  Steven William Bruns appeared. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial. ADA Hartung requests $500.00 CB, Atty Kucinski argues. Defendant is on a PO hold.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
